column4: dual- triple- or quadruple-booting actually is a breeze... when the prerequisites are right, and you know abot grub :-)
understanding the menu.lst and having a small service partition as the first one helps a lot...
Fedora's GUI installer was probably the biggest help. It is pretty good
welcome to the wonderful world of error free syntax :-)
in case you do not use the provided boot line from grub: you need to pass the UUID of the root volume now, not the /dev no more
Yeah, I already did on Edgy. It panics a short time after loading GDM
heard that song before... Feisty isn't as well tested as we all wish it had been. Any log entries which might be useful?
I tried looking about in dmesg but can't find what is going on just before the kernel panic, since it gets full of the new boot messages
what kind of system is that? Do you have SATA or PATA-hd?
SATA. Dapper didn't recognise it, but Edgy did.

then you might be a "victim" of the libata experiments currently taking place in the so-called stable kernel... all i can tell is 'search the forums', i finally rolled my own kernel. Maybe someone else knows what's wrong
OK, thanks anyway. Was just wondering if it was a known issue, and maybe whether installing from scratch would have the same problem
the kernel has it's problems, so a reinstall won't fix it, i guess
Well at least I won't go wiping my system for nothing now :)
Thanks for the help, I think I've found it reported in Launchpad and using irqpoll, noapic and nolapic on GRUB's kernel line apparently worked for some people so I'll give it a shot. Cheers
that's a frequently heard issue with feisty...
